label: How St. Piran at Perran Beach
column6: a pious man from South Ireland
column7: performed numerous miracles but was cast into the sea with a millstone by jealous locals; miraculously
column8: the storm abated and he drifted safely to Cornwall on the millstone. In Cornwall
column9: he converted the locals to Christianity
column13: particularly commemorated in the district of the Perran Sands where he lived and died.

label: St. David and His Mother
column6: born to a pious Welsh princess named Non and a barbarous chief
column7: established a sanctuary known as 'The Monk's Dyke' on lands given by his remorseful grandfather
column8: leading a peaceful life of conversion and miracles. Following his death
column9: a cathedral was built in his honor in the city of St. Davids
column10: a unique and picturesque location on the Welsh coast that visitors can still explore today.
